column1: 16:42|In a dream Seymour walks beneath trees towards a cluster of white tents
column2: but every time he takes step forward
column3: the trail twists and the tents recede
column4: and a terrible confusion presses down on him. He wakes with a start. The dashboard clock says 4:42 p.m. How long did he sleep?|Cloud Cuckoo Land|Anthony Doerr

column1: 16:42|I'm always happy when I reach the finish line of a long-distance race
column2: but this time it really struck me hard. I pumped my right fist into the air. The time was 4:42 pm. Eleven hours and forty-two minutes since the start of the race.|What I Talk About When I Talk About Running|Haruki Murakami
